reasoning: Symptomatic primary EBV infection (infectious mononucleosis) ~240 per 100k annually in developed countries. Seroprevalence very high globally (~90% by adulthood, 90,000 per 100k with past infection). Incidence varies by age and socioeconomic status; higher in developing countries during childhood, presenting differently (asymptomatic). Reporting symptomatic disease incidence as clinically relevant metric.
source: Jenson HB. (2004). Epstein-Barr virus. Pediatr Rev. 25(6):181-189
